column1: #Text=[0001] The invention relates to a method for real-time determination of the mass of particles present in a particle filter for the combustion engine of a motor vehicle.
#Text=[0002] The invention also relates to the use of this method in a method for management of an engine, especially engines running on lean mixture.

#Text=[0003] As it happens, the heterogeneity of the combustion processes in engines running on lean mixture has the effect of generating carbon particles which cannot be burned efficiently by the engine.
#Text=That is expressed by the production of black exhaust smoke, characteristic of this type of engine, especially during starting phases and during hard accelerations.
#Text=Compliance with future legislative standards requires the use of depollution systems capable of completely eliminating the particles as well as the nitrogen oxides.

#Text=[0004] For this purpose there is now available a semi-porous element forming a particle filter in the exhaust line, which permits the gaseous components to pass but retains the particulate compounds.
#Text=In diesel engines, the fumes make us the basic constituent of these particulate compounds.
